instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.ADAPTER_EN: What is ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light no power
threads.message:
hey all! I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A MacBook 2008 15" that has a green light on the charger but won't start either by pressing power button or shorting the power on pads.

<TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1=16.93v Pin 2=5.73 Pin 6=16.93v

<TRANSISTOR>Q6915</TRANSISTOR>  Pin 2=2.3v Pin 3=7.39v Pin 5=0v Pin 6=0v

<CHIP>U6915</CHIP> Pin 1=8.05v Pin 3=3.28v Pin 4=0v Pin 5=16.90v

<RESISTOR>R6911</RESISTOR> Pin 1= 16.93v Pin 2=5.72v

<RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR>= Pin 1=5.7v Pin 2=0v

<RESISTOR>R6910</RESISTOR> Pin 1=2.30v Pin 2=2.30v

<CAPACITOR>C6910</CAPACITOR> Pin 1=2.3v

<TRANSISTOR>Q6920</TRANSISTOR> Pin 1=3.36v Pin 2=7.38v Pin 3=3.36v Pin 4=3.36v Pin 5=7.38c Pin 6=3.36v

<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> Pin 1=1.08v

I haven't worked on one of these so I'm not sure what I'm missing. I also don't have another model of this board to reference. Any help would be appreciated!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light no power
threads.message:
If you get green light on magsafe, means <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> circuit is working...
Does it switch to amber when battery is connected?
Check resistance to ground at L6995 on 200K scale.
Do you get correct voltage at F7040?
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts when pressing power button?
Also check RTC signals and <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light no power
threads.message: ok thanks will do and post findings

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light no power
threads.message: Are you using a REAL 85W charger? <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> high? PPBUS, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green light no power
threads.message: There was some funky stuff going on with the via between <TRANSISTOR>Q6915</TRANSISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> so I replaced them both and ran a jumper in it's place.  After that, computer starts normally and all measurements are accurate and battery is detected and charging.  Thanks for your help!
